evs4j
Interface Message

public interface Message

Interface for totally-ordered messages.

Method Summary
 byte[] getData()
          Returns the buffer containing the data.
 int getId()
          Returns the unique id of this message, or is undefined if the Message has not been sent yet.
 int getLength()
          Returns the number of useful bytes in the array starting at the offset.
 int getOffset()
          Returns the position of the first byte of the message.
 Processor getSender()
          Returns the Processor object of the processor that originated this message.
 boolean isSafe()
          Returns true iff the message was or will be delivered as safe (i.e.
 void setLength(int length)
          Sets the number of useful bytes in the array starting at the offset.
 

Method Detail

isSafe

boolean isSafe()
Returns true iff the message was or will be delivered as safe (i.e. it is not delivered until all the processors have acknowledged receipt.)

getId

int getId()
Returns the unique id of this message, or is undefined if the Message has not been sent yet. This id is unique within its configuration, and is the same for all processors.

getData

byte[] getData()
Returns the buffer containing the data.

getOffset

int getOffset()
Returns the position of the first byte of the message.

getLength

int getLength()
Returns the number of useful bytes in the array starting at the offset.

getSender

Processor getSender()
Returns the Processor object of the processor that originated this message.

setLength

void setLength(int length)
Sets the number of useful bytes in the array starting at the offset.
